other_tests.findings: The histopathologic examination of the masses revealed scattered giant cells in a fibroblastic stroma containing small vascular channels. The lesion was interpreted as giant cell reparative granuloma.
Large reddish brown, friable, vascular masses surrounded by calcified cortex were excised.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Eighteen months postoperatively, the optic nerve dysfunction, proptosis, and diplopia in upgaze remained. Seven years after her initial orbital surgery, she had a recurrence in the left orbital floor with direct compression on the optic nerve.
Visual field defects resolved after surgical intervention.
